title: Watch Richard and Judy’s This Morning debut over 30 years ago ahead of comeback
text:
Judy Finnigan and Richard Madeley hosted the show for over a decade (Picture: ITV/REX)

Richard Madeley and Judy Finnigan are set to present This Morning for the first time in 18 years, but can you remember their first appearance?

The husband and wife duo launched the breakfast show 31 years ago, and presented the show for over a decade until July 2001.

This Morning’s first episode aired live on 3 October in 1988 from the Granada studio inside Liverpool’s Albert Dock, and lasted for 90 minutes.

In a throwback clip of the first ever episode, you’ll see the show’s format hasn’t changed that much – boasting a line-up covering food, shopping and fashion tips with added discussions around finance and family life.

There’s also, as Judy promises, a ‘famous face dropping in for coffee’. The first ever celebrity guest was actor Paul Nicholas, known for starring in 1983 sitcom Just Good Friends.

The show was launched with hardly any publicity and went onto become a surprise success, rising to a daily average of two million viewers.

In 1996, the show moved studios from Liverpool to London to accommodate easier travel for celebrity guests.

Judy Finnigan and Richard Madeley in 1991 (Picture: ITV/REX)

Richard and Judy’s stint on the show saw them cover Princess Diana’s death and interview then Prime Minister Margaret Thatcher, before they moved to host a new Channel 4 talk show in 2001.

Speaking about returning to the show in a joint statement, the pair said: ‘This Morning holds a very special place in our hearts, so we couldn’t be more delighted to take the helm once again.’

The show originally aired in Liverpool’s Albert Dock (Picture: YouTube)

Richard makes frequent TV appearances now hosting Good Morning Britain, and recently became a contestant on Channel 4 reality show The Circle.

This Morning is now hosted alternatively by Holly Willoughby and Phillip Schofield, and Eamonn Holmes and Ruth Langsford.

You can catch This Morning weekdays on ITV at 10.30am.
